item.title: M1.Key Concepts And Terminology
item.description: Goals of module: Define terms Differentiate btw health inequality and health inequity; describe key concepts that intersect with health inequality monitoring activities; describe how equity is relevant to the SDG.

item.title: M3. Cycle of monitoring
item.description: Five steps in HIM. It is a cyclic and iterative process.

item.title: 0.Intro
item.description: General Notes Healthy Inequality definition: Observable health difference between social groups.

item.title: Mx.Description of all modules
item.description: The modules described in this course are the following: M1. Household Surveys M2. Administrative Data Sources M3.

item.title: Welcome to Quartz 4
item.description: Notes from WHO HIM This is a book that compiles notes on WHO HIM eLearning Courses. These notes are for internal sharing in the Equity Team.

item.title: 0. Intro
item.description: Goals of course: Situate the step of obtaining data within the cycle of health inequality monitoring; Describe the attributes of high-quality data sources for health inequality monitoring; Describe general categories of data sources; Review the components of this course.

item.title: M4. WHO resources
item.description: WHO has developed numerous resources to support health inequality monitoring, which are all accessible through the Health Inequality Monitor website: health inequality data repository; HEAT and HEAT Plus; statistical codes; the handbook on health inequality monitoring; step-by-step manuals and the c...

item.title: M2.Situating HIM
item.description: Goal of module Discuss the importance and purpose of health inequality monitoring, and describe who is involved, when it should be done, and how it is aligned within health information systems and other health sector activities.
